data.question: What is the title of the research paper?
data.answer: Controllable Photomechanical Bending of Metal-organic Rotaxane Crystals Facilitated by Regioselective Confined-Space Photodimerization

data.question: Who are the authors of the research paper?
data.answer: Jun-shan Geng, Lei Mei, Yuan-yuan Liang, Li-yong Yuan, Ji-pan Yu, Kong-qiu Hu, Li-hua Yuan, Wen Feng, Zhi-fang Chai, Wei-qun Shi

data.question: What is the main focus of the research?
data.answer: The research focuses on the synthesis of a photoresponsive metal-organic rotaxane framework (MORF) compound, U-CB[8]-MPyVB, that can undergo controllable macroscopic mechanical responses under light irradiation.

data.question: What triggers the macroscopic bending of U-CB[8]-MPyVB crystals?
data.answer: The macroscopic bending of U-CB[8]-MPyVB crystals is triggered by UV light irradiation.

data.question: What is the role of cucurbit[8]uril (CB[8]) in the formation of U-CB[8]-MPyVB?
data.answer: Cucurbit[8]uril (CB[8]) plays a crucial role in the formation of U-CB[8]-MPyVB by facilitating the regioselective solid-state [2 + 2] photodimerization through its confinement effect and participating in coordination with the photoactive MPyVB guest molecules.

data.question: How does the structure of U-CB[8]-MPyVB change under UV irradiation?
data.answer: Under UV irradiation, U-CB[8]-MPyVB undergoes a single-crystal-to-single-crystal (SCSC) transformation through a regioselective solid-state [2 + 2] photodimerization reaction, leading to structural changes at the molecular level.

data.question: Is the bending rate of U-CB[8]-MPyVB crystals fast compared to other photoresponsive materials?
data.answer: False. The bending rate of U-CB[8]-MPyVB crystals is significantly slower compared to other photoresponsive materials, providing an opportunity to precisely control bending motion in a controllable manner.

data.question: Does the presence of CB[8] affect the efficiency of photodimerization in U-CB[8]-MPyVB?
data.answer: True. The presence of CB[8] affects the efficiency of photodimerization in U-CB[8]-MPyVB by confining the photoactive ligands, which influences the light penetration efficiency and the absorption of light by the photoactive groups.

data.question: Can U-CB[8]-MPyVB crystals maintain their bending morphology after the removal of the incident light source?
data.answer: True. U-CB[8]-MPyVB crystals maintain their bending morphology even after the removal of the incident light source, indicating good stability in air.

data.question: What is the significance of the adaptive deformation of CB[8] in the formation of photoactive motif in U-CB[8]-MPyVB?
data.answer: The adaptive deformation of CB[8] is significant in the formation of the photoactive motif in U-CB[8]-MPyVB as it allows CB[8] to participate in coordination with the metal center along with the axle molecule, bringing the photoactive ligands closer for efficient photodimerization.
